block.p: Eleanor Ann Dillon, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin P. Dillon of Merrick, L.I., was married yesterday to Daniel Petigrow, the son of Dr. and Mrs. Charles Petigrow of Stony Brook, L.I. Rabbi Moshe Edelman and Cantor Jacob Merlis performed the ceremony at the Old Westbury (L.I.) Hebrew Congregation.

Mrs. Petigrow, 25 years old and a Cornell University graduate, is a senior account executive at the Burson-Marsteller public-relations company in New York. Her father, a labor relations lawyer in Merrick, retired as the executive vice president of the Printers League of the Association of Graphic Arts in New York. Her mother, Susan Dillon, is a teacher at the Wheeler Avenue Elementary School in Valley Stream, L.I.

The bridegroom, 26, is a graduate of Brandeis University with a law degree from Fordham Unviersity. He is an associate in the law offices of Ronald J. DeVito in Garden City, L.I. His mother, Sandra Petigrow, is a personnel associate at the New York State Teacher Registry in Hauppauge, L.I. His father is a pediatrician in Stony Brook.
